Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown ribbed pottery vessel, fabric is black in section, interior slightly grooved, with remains of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.190)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36456) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36456)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 315 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
